# customsubcategory=facebook=Facebook application settings
# customsubcategory=fbrequest=Facebook request settings

# cat=basic/facebook/10; type=string; label=Facebook appId: The appId of your application, needed to connect the API to Facebook
appId=

# cat=basic/facebook/20; type=string; label=Facebook app secret: The secret generated by Facebook for you app, needed to connect to the API
secret=

# cat=advanced/fbrequest/10; type=options[TRUE=TRUE,FALSE=FALSE]; label=Facebook file upload: Optional, allow to upload file to facebook
fileUpload=FALSE

# cat=advanced/fbrequest/20; type=options[TRUE=TRUE,FALSE=FALSE]; label=Facebook trust forwarded: Optional
trustForwarded=FALSE

# cat=advanced/fbrequest/30; type=options[TRUE=TRUE,FALSE=FALSE]; label=Facebook allow signed request: Optional but should be set to false for non-canvas apps
allowSignedRequest=FALSE

# cat=advanced/fbrequest/40; type=options[TRUE=TRUE,FALSE=FALSE]; label=Facebook session shared: Optional, turn on a secondary cookie for environments with a shared session (that is, your app shares the domain with other apps)
sharedSession=FALSE

# cat=debug/enable/10; type=boolean; label=Activate debug page and script: You can use page type 301 to test your Facebook configuration and see what you get from the connector. You need to include the debug static template after the main FB connector static template
showDebug=
